intro: Pectis multiseta var. multiseta, commonly known as the multiset pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant features hairy, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its structure and growth habits make it well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
